prompt: <description>Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism has a flat top and bottom. The cylindrical hole is centered along the length of the prism. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The cylindrical hole has a diameter of approximately 0.5 units. Part 1 Construct a cylindrical object with a rectangular hole in the center. The object has a smooth surface and is symmetrical along its central axis. The hole is cylindrical and has a smaller diameter than the object itself. The object is centered on a white background. 1.1 Define the coordinate system: * Set the Euler Angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0]. * Set the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.5, 0.0]. 1.2 Create the 2D sketch on the XY plane: * Create a new face (face\\_1). * Draw loop\\_1: + line\\_1 from (0.0, 0.0) to (0.0, 0.125). + line\\_2 from (0.0, 0.125) to (0.0, 0.25). + arc\\_1 from (0.0, 0.25) with center (0.25, 0.5) and end point (0.5, 0.25). + line\\_3 from (0.5, 0.25) to (0.625, 0.25). + arc\\_2 from (0.625, 0.25) with center (0.7134, 0.2134) and end point (0.75, 0.125). + line\\_4 from (0.75, 0.125) to (0.75, 0.0). + line\\_5 from (0.75, 0.0) to (0.0, 0.0) to close loop\\_1. 1.3 Create loop\\_2: * Draw circle\\_1 with center at (0.25, 0.25) and radius 0.125. 1.4 Define the 3D sketch: * Scale the sketch by 0.75 using the sketch\\_scale parameter. * Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 1.5 Extrude the 2D sketch: * Extrude the sketch by 0.25 units along the normal (NewBodyFeatureOperation). Part 2 Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The height is approximately twice the width. The length of the sides is equal. 2.1 Define the coordinate system: * Set the Euler Angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0]. * Set the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.25, 0.0]. 2.2 Create the 2D sketch on the XY plane: * Create a new face (face\\_1). * Draw loop\\_1: + line\\_1 from (0.0, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0). + line\\_2 from (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.125). + line\\_3 from (0.75, 0.125) to (0.25, 0.125). + line\\_4 from (0.25, 0.125) to (0.0, 0.125). + line\\_5 from (0.0, 0.125) to (0.0, 0.0) to close loop\\_1. 2.3 Define the 3D sketch: * Scale the sketch by 0.75 using the sketch\\_scale parameter. * Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 2.4 Extrude the 2D sketch: * Extrude the sketch by 0.25 units along the normal (JoinFeatureOperation). When combining Part 1 and Part 2, use the appropriate boolean operation to form a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center.</description>
